001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.*;
008import squidpony.annotation.GwtIncompatible;
009
010import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
011import java.io.DataOutputStream;
012import java.io.IOException;
013import java.io.OutputStream;
014import java.util.zip.CRC32;
015import java.util.zip.CheckedOutputStream;
016import java.util.zip.Deflater;
017import java.util.zip.DeflaterOutputStream;
018
019/** PNG-8 encoder with compression. An instance can be reused to encode multiple PNGs with minimal allocation.
020 * You can configure the target palette and how this can dither colors via the {@link #palette} field, which is a
021 * {@link PaletteReducer} object that is allowed to be null and can be reused. The methods
022 * {@link PaletteReducer#exact(Color[])} or {@link PaletteReducer#analyze(Pixmap)} can be used to make the target
023 * palette match a specific set of colors or the colors in an existing image. You can use
024 * {@link PaletteReducer#setDitherStrength(float)} to reduce (or increase) dither strength; the dithering algorithm used
025 * here is a modified version of the algorithm presented in "Simple gradient-based error-diffusion method" by Xaingyu Y.
026 * Hu in the Journal of Electronic Imaging, 2016. This algorithm uses pseudo-randomly-generated noise (it is
027 * deterministic, and is seeded using the color information) to adjust Floyd-Steinberg dithering. It yields
028 * surprisingly non-random-looking dithers, but still manages to break up artificial patterns most of the time.
029 * Note that much of the time you will want to use {@link #writePrecisely(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean)} instead of
030 * {@link #write(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, boolean)}, since writePrecisely will attempt to reproduce the exact colors
031 * if there are 256 colors or less in the Pixmap, and will automatically change to calling write() if there are more
032 * than 256 colors.
033 * <br>
034 * From LibGDX in the class PixmapIO, with modifications to support indexed-mode files, dithering, and other features.
035 * <pre>
036 * Copyright (c) 2007 Matthias Mann - www.matthiasmann.de
037 * Copyright (c) 2014 Nathan Sweet
038 * Copyright (c) 2018 Tommy Ettinger
039 *
040 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
041 * of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
042 * in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
043 * to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
044 * copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
045 * furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:
046 *
047 * The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in
048 * all copies or substantial portions of the Software.
049 *
050 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
051 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
052 * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
053 * AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
054 * LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
055 * OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN
056 * THE SOFTWARE.
057 * </pre>
058 * @author Matthias Mann
059 * @author Nathan Sweet
060 * @author Tommy Ettinger (PNG-8 parts only) */
061
062// If you're porting this into libGDX, remove the GwtIncompatible annotation and exclude this from GWT reflection.
063// You'll also need to include the PaletteReducer class, which only depends on libGDX and the JDK, and does not need to
064// be excluded from GWT in any way. 
065@GwtIncompatible
066public class PNG8 implements Disposable {
067    static private final byte[] SIGNATURE = {(byte)137, 80, 78, 71, 13, 10, 26, 10};
068    static private final int IHDR = 0x49484452, IDAT = 0x49444154, IEND = 0x49454E44,
069            PLTE = 0x504C5445, TRNS = 0x74524E53,
070            acTL = 0x6163544C, fcTL = 0x6663544C, fdAT = 0x66644154;
071    static private final byte COLOR_INDEXED = 3;
072    static private final byte COMPRESSION_DEFLATE = 0;
073    static private final byte FILTER_NONE = 0;
074    static private final byte INTERLACE_NONE = 0;
075    static private final byte PAETH = 4;
076
077    private final ChunkBuffer buffer;
078    private final Deflater deflater;
079    private ByteArray lineOutBytes, curLineBytes, prevLineBytes;
080    private boolean flipY = true;
081    private int lastLineLen;
082
083    public PaletteReducer palette;
084    
085    public PNG8() {
086        this(128 * 128);
087    }
088
089    public PNG8(int initialBufferSize) {
090        buffer = new ChunkBuffer(initialBufferSize);
091        deflater = new Deflater();
092    }
093
094    /** If true, the resulting PNG is flipped vertically. Default is true. */
095    public void setFlipY (boolean flipY) {
096        this.flipY = flipY;
097    }
098
099    /** Sets the deflate compression level. Default is {@link Deflater#DEFAULT_COMPRESSION}. */
100    public void setCompression (int level) {
101        deflater.setLevel(level);
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * Writes the given Pixmap to the requested FileHandle, computing an 8-bit palette from the most common colors in
106     * pixmap. If there are 256 or less colors and none are transparent, this will use 256 colors in its palette exactly
107     * with no transparent entry, but if there are more than 256 colors or any are transparent, then one color will be
108     * used for "fully transparent" and 255 opaque colors will be used.
109     * @param file a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
110     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given file
111     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
112     */
113    public void write (FileHandle file, Pixmap pixmap) throws IOException {
114        write(file, pixmap, true);
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * Writes the given Pixmap to the requested FileHandle, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the most common
119     * colors in pixmap. When computePalette is true, if there are 256 or less colors and none are transparent, this
120     * will use 256 colors in its palette exactly with no transparent entry, but if there are more than 256 colors or
121     * any are transparent, then one color will be used for "fully transparent" and 255 opaque colors will be used. When
122     * computePalette is false, this uses the last palette this had computed, or a 253-color bold palette with one
123     * fully-transparent color if no palette had been computed yet.
124     * @param file a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
125     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given file
126     * @param computePalette if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
127     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
128     */
129    public void write (FileHandle file, Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette) throws IOException {
130        OutputStream output = file.write(false);
131        try {
132            write(output, pixmap, computePalette);
133        } finally {
134            StreamUtils.closeQuietly(output);
135        }
136    }
137    /**
138     * Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given
139     * Pixmap. If {@link #palette} is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will
140     * compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette. Optionally dithers the result if
141     * {@code dither} is true.
142     * @param file a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
143     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
144     * @param computePalette if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
145     * @param dither true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
146     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
147     */
148    public void write (FileHandle file, Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette, boolean dither) throws IOException {
149        OutputStream output = file.write(false);
150        try {
151            write(output, pixmap, computePalette, dither);
152        } finally {
153            StreamUtils.closeQuietly(output);
154        }
155    }
156    /**
157     * Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given
158     * Pixmap. If {@link #palette} is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will
159     * compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette. Uses the given threshold while analyzing
160     * the palette if this needs to compute a palette; threshold values can be as low as 0 to try to use as many colors
161     * as possible (prefer {@link  #writePrecisely(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, int)} for that, though) and can range up
162     * to very high numbers if very few colors should be used; usually threshold is from 100 to 800. Optionally dithers
163     * the result if {@code dither} is true.
164     * @param file a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
165     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
166     * @param computePalette if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
167     * @param dither true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
168     * @param threshold the analysis threshold to use if computePalette is true (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
169     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
170     */
171    public void write (FileHandle file, Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette, boolean dither, int threshold) throws IOException {
172        OutputStream output = file.write(false);
173        try {
174            write(output, pixmap, computePalette, dither, threshold);
175        } finally {
176            StreamUtils.closeQuietly(output);
177        }
178    }
179
180    /** Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream and computes an 8-bit palette from the Pixmap.
181     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
182     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
183     */
184    public void write (OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap) throws IOException {
185        writePrecisely(output, pixmap, true);
186    }
187
188    /**
189     * Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given
190     * Pixmap. If {@link #palette} is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will
191     * compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette.
192     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
193     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
194     * @param computePalette if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
195     */
196    public void write (OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette) throws IOException     
197    {
198        if(computePalette)
199            writePrecisely(output, pixmap, true);
200        else
201            write(output, pixmap, false, true);
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given
206     * Pixmap. If {@link #palette} is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will
207     * compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette.
208     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
209     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
210     * @param computePalette if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
211     * @param dither true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
212     */
213    public void write (OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette, boolean dither) throws IOException
214    {
215        write(output, pixmap, computePalette, dither, 400);
216    }
217    /**
218     * Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given
219     * Pixmap. If {@link #palette} is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will
220     * compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette.
221     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
222     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
223     * @param computePalette if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
224     * @param dither true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
225     * @param threshold the analysis threshold to use if computePalette is true (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
226     */
227    public void write (OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette, boolean dither, int threshold) throws IOException
228    {
229        if(palette == null)
230        {
231            palette = new PaletteReducer(pixmap, threshold);
232        }
233        else if(computePalette)
234        {
235            palette.analyze(pixmap, threshold);
236        }
237
238        if(dither) writeDithered(output, pixmap);
239        else writeSolid(output, pixmap);
240    }
241    /**
242     * Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to file; this attempt will only succeed if there
243     * are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent).
244     * If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling {@link #write(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, boolean)}, which
245     * can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will
246     * always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette. All other write() methods in this class will
247     * reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the
248     * non-alpha components of colors exactly.
249     * @param file a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
250     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
251     * @param ditherFallback if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
252     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
253     */
254    public void writePrecisely (FileHandle file, Pixmap pixmap, boolean ditherFallback) throws IOException {
255        writePrecisely(file, pixmap, ditherFallback, 400);
256    }
257    /**
258     * Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to file; this attempt will only succeed if there
259     * are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent).
260     * If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling {@link #write(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, boolean)}, which
261     * can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will
262     * always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette, using the given threshold for analysis (which is
263     * typically between 1 and 1000, and most often near 200-400). All other write() methods in this class will
264     * reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the
265     * non-alpha components of colors exactly.
266     * @param file a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
267     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
268     * @param ditherFallback if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
269     * @param threshold the analysis threshold to use if there are too many colors (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
270     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
271     */
272    public void writePrecisely (FileHandle file, Pixmap pixmap, boolean ditherFallback, int threshold) throws IOException {
273        OutputStream output = file.write(false);
274        try {
275            writePrecisely(output, pixmap, ditherFallback, threshold);
276        } finally {
277            StreamUtils.closeQuietly(output);
278        }
279    }
280
281    /**
282     * Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to output; this attempt will only succeed if there
283     * are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent).
284     * If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling {@link #write(OutputStream, Pixmap, boolean, boolean)}, which
285     * can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will
286     * always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette. All other write() methods in this class will
287     * reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the
288     * non-alpha components of colors exactly.
289     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
290     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
291     * @param ditherFallback if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
292     * @throws IOException if OutputStream things fail for any reason
293     */
294    public void writePrecisely(OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap, boolean ditherFallback) throws IOException {
295        writePrecisely(output, pixmap, ditherFallback, 400);
296    }
297
298    /**
299     * Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to output; this attempt will only succeed if there
300     * are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent).
301     * If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling {@link #write(OutputStream, Pixmap, boolean, boolean)}, which
302     * can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will
303     * always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette, using the given threshold for analysis (which is
304     * typically between 1 and 1000, and most often near 200-400). All other write() methods in this class will
305     * reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the
306     * non-alpha components of colors exactly.
307     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
308     * @param pixmap a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
309     * @param ditherFallback if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
310     * @param threshold the analysis threshold to use if there are too many colors (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
311     * @throws IOException if OutputStream things fail for any reason
312     */
313    public void writePrecisely(OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap, boolean ditherFallback, int threshold) throws IOException {
314        IntIntMap colorToIndex = new IntIntMap(256);
315        colorToIndex.put(0, 0);
316        int color;
317        int hasTransparent = 0;
318        final int w = pixmap.getWidth(), h = pixmap.getHeight();
319        for (int y = 0; y < h; y++) {
320            int py = flipY ? (h - y - 1) : y;
321            for (int px = 0; px < w; px++) {
322                color = pixmap.getPixel(px, py);
323                if((color & 0xFE) != 0xFE) {
324                    if(hasTransparent == 0 && colorToIndex.size >= 256)                     
325                    {
326                        write(output, pixmap, true, ditherFallback, threshold);
327                        return;
328                    }
329                    hasTransparent = 1;
330                }
331                else if(!colorToIndex.containsKey(color))
332                {
333                    colorToIndex.put(color, colorToIndex.size & 255);
334                    if(colorToIndex.size == 257 && hasTransparent == 0)
335                    {
336                        colorToIndex.remove(0, 0);
337                    }
338                    if(colorToIndex.size > 256)
339                    {
340                        write(output, pixmap, true, ditherFallback, threshold);
341                        return;
342                    }
343                }
344            }
345        }
346        int[] paletteArray = new int[colorToIndex.size];
347        for(IntIntMap.Entry ent : colorToIndex)
348        {
349            paletteArray[ent.value] = ent.key;
350        }
351        DeflaterOutputStream deflaterOutput = new DeflaterOutputStream(buffer, deflater);
352        DataOutputStream dataOutput = new DataOutputStream(output);
353        dataOutput.write(SIGNATURE);
354
355        buffer.writeInt(IHDR);
356        buffer.writeInt(pixmap.getWidth());
357        buffer.writeInt(pixmap.getHeight());
358        buffer.writeByte(8); // 8 bits per component.
359        buffer.writeByte(COLOR_INDEXED);
360        buffer.writeByte(COMPRESSION_DEFLATE);
361        buffer.writeByte(FILTER_NONE);
362        buffer.writeByte(INTERLACE_NONE);
363        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
364
365        buffer.writeInt(PLTE);
366        for (int i = 0; i < paletteArray.length; i++) {
367            int p = paletteArray[i];
368            buffer.write(p>>>24);
369            buffer.write(p>>>16);
370            buffer.write(p>>>8);
371        }
372        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
373
374        if(hasTransparent == 1) {
375            buffer.writeInt(TRNS);
376            buffer.write(0);
377            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
378        }
379        buffer.writeInt(IDAT);
380        deflater.reset();
381
382        int lineLen = pixmap.getWidth();
383        byte[] lineOut, curLine, prevLine;
384        if (lineOutBytes == null) {
385            lineOut = (lineOutBytes = new ByteArray(lineLen)).items;
386            curLine = (curLineBytes = new ByteArray(lineLen)).items;
387            prevLine = (prevLineBytes = new ByteArray(lineLen)).items;
388        } else {
389            lineOut = lineOutBytes.ensureCapacity(lineLen);
390            curLine = curLineBytes.ensureCapacity(lineLen);
391            prevLine = prevLineBytes.ensureCapacity(lineLen);
392            for (int i = 0, n = lastLineLen; i < n; i++)
393            {
394                prevLine[i] = 0;
395            }
396        }
397
398        lastLineLen = lineLen;
399
400        for (int y = 0; y < h; y++) {
401            int py = flipY ? (h - y - 1) : y;
402            for (int px = 0; px < w; px++) {
403                color = pixmap.getPixel(px, py);
404                curLine[px] = (byte) colorToIndex.get(color, 0);
405            }
406
407            lineOut[0] = (byte)(curLine[0] - prevLine[0]);
408
409            //Paeth
410            for (int x = 1; x < lineLen; x++) {
411                int a = curLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
412                int b = prevLine[x] & 0xff;
413                int c = prevLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
414                int p = a + b - c;
415                int pa = p - a;
416                if (pa < 0) pa = -pa;
417                int pb = p - b;
418                if (pb < 0) pb = -pb;
419                int pc = p - c;
420                if (pc < 0) pc = -pc;
421                if (pa <= pb && pa <= pc)
422                    c = a;
423                else if (pb <= pc)
424                    c = b;
425                lineOut[x] = (byte)(curLine[x] - c);
426            }
427
428            deflaterOutput.write(PAETH);
429            deflaterOutput.write(lineOut, 0, lineLen);
430
431            byte[] temp = curLine;
432            curLine = prevLine;
433            prevLine = temp;
434        }
435        deflaterOutput.finish();
436        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
437
438        buffer.writeInt(IEND);
439        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
440
441        output.flush();
442
443    }
444    
445    private void writeSolid (OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap) throws IOException{
446        final int[] paletteArray = palette.paletteArray;
447        final byte[] paletteMapping = palette.paletteMapping;
448
449        DeflaterOutputStream deflaterOutput = new DeflaterOutputStream(buffer, deflater);
450        DataOutputStream dataOutput = new DataOutputStream(output);
451        dataOutput.write(SIGNATURE);
452
453        buffer.writeInt(IHDR);
454        buffer.writeInt(pixmap.getWidth());
455        buffer.writeInt(pixmap.getHeight());
456        buffer.writeByte(8); // 8 bits per component.
457        buffer.writeByte(COLOR_INDEXED);
458        buffer.writeByte(COMPRESSION_DEFLATE);
459        buffer.writeByte(FILTER_NONE);
460        buffer.writeByte(INTERLACE_NONE);
461        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
462
463        buffer.writeInt(PLTE);
464        for (int i = 0; i < paletteArray.length; i++) {
465            int p = paletteArray[i];
466            buffer.write(p>>>24);
467            buffer.write(p>>>16);
468            buffer.write(p>>>8);
469        }
470        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
471
472        boolean hasTransparent = false;
473        if(paletteArray[0] == 0) {
474            hasTransparent = true;
475            buffer.writeInt(TRNS);
476            buffer.write(0);
477            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
478        }
479        buffer.writeInt(IDAT);
480        deflater.reset();
481
482        int lineLen = pixmap.getWidth();
483        byte[] lineOut, curLine, prevLine;
484        if (lineOutBytes == null) {
485            lineOut = (lineOutBytes = new ByteArray(lineLen)).items;
486            curLine = (curLineBytes = new ByteArray(lineLen)).items;
487            prevLine = (prevLineBytes = new ByteArray(lineLen)).items;
488        } else {
489            lineOut = lineOutBytes.ensureCapacity(lineLen);
490            curLine = curLineBytes.ensureCapacity(lineLen);
491            prevLine = prevLineBytes.ensureCapacity(lineLen);
492            for (int i = 0, n = lastLineLen; i < n; i++)
493            {
494                prevLine[i] = 0;
495            }
496        }
497
498        lastLineLen = lineLen;
499
500        int color;
501        final int w = pixmap.getWidth(), h = pixmap.getHeight();
502        for (int y = 0; y < h; y++) {
503            int py = flipY ? (h - y - 1) : y;
504            for (int px = 0; px < w; px++) {
505                color = pixmap.getPixel(px, py);
506                if ((color & 0x80) == 0 && hasTransparent)
507                    curLine[px] = 0;
508                else {
509                    int rr = ((color >>> 24)       );
510                    int gg = ((color >>> 16) & 0xFF);
511                    int bb = ((color >>> 8)  & 0xFF);
512                    curLine[px] = paletteMapping[((rr << 7) & 0x7C00)
513                                    | ((gg << 2) & 0x3E0)
514                                    | ((bb >>> 3))];
515                }
516            }
517
518            lineOut[0] = (byte)(curLine[0] - prevLine[0]);
519
520            //Paeth
521            for (int x = 1; x < lineLen; x++) {
522                int a = curLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
523                int b = prevLine[x] & 0xff;
524                int c = prevLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
525                int p = a + b - c;
526                int pa = p - a;
527                if (pa < 0) pa = -pa;
528                int pb = p - b;
529                if (pb < 0) pb = -pb;
530                int pc = p - c;
531                if (pc < 0) pc = -pc;
532                if (pa <= pb && pa <= pc)
533                    c = a;
534                else if (pb <= pc)
535                    c = b;
536                lineOut[x] = (byte)(curLine[x] - c);
537            }
538
539            deflaterOutput.write(PAETH);
540            deflaterOutput.write(lineOut, 0, lineLen);
541
542            byte[] temp = curLine;
543            curLine = prevLine;
544            prevLine = temp;
545        }
546        deflaterOutput.finish();
547        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
548
549        buffer.writeInt(IEND);
550        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
551
552        output.flush();
553    }
554
555    private void writeDithered (OutputStream output, Pixmap pixmap) throws IOException{
556        DeflaterOutputStream deflaterOutput = new DeflaterOutputStream(buffer, deflater);
557        final int[] paletteArray = palette.paletteArray;
558        final byte[] paletteMapping = palette.paletteMapping;
559        
560        DataOutputStream dataOutput = new DataOutputStream(output);
561        dataOutput.write(SIGNATURE);
562
563        buffer.writeInt(IHDR);
564        buffer.writeInt(pixmap.getWidth());
565        buffer.writeInt(pixmap.getHeight());
566        buffer.writeByte(8); // 8 bits per component.
567        buffer.writeByte(COLOR_INDEXED);
568        buffer.writeByte(COMPRESSION_DEFLATE);
569        buffer.writeByte(FILTER_NONE);
570        buffer.writeByte(INTERLACE_NONE);
571        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
572
573        buffer.writeInt(PLTE);
574        for (int i = 0; i < paletteArray.length; i++) {
575            int p = paletteArray[i];
576            buffer.write(p>>>24);
577            buffer.write(p>>>16);
578            buffer.write(p>>>8);
579        }
580        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
581
582        boolean hasTransparent = false;
583        if(paletteArray[0] == 0) {
584            hasTransparent = true;
585            buffer.writeInt(TRNS);
586            buffer.write(0);
587            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
588        }
589        buffer.writeInt(IDAT);
590        deflater.reset();
591
592        final int w = pixmap.getWidth(), h = pixmap.getHeight();
593        byte[] lineOut, curLine, prevLine;
594        if (lineOutBytes == null) {
595            lineOut = (lineOutBytes = new ByteArray(w)).items;
596            curLine = (curLineBytes = new ByteArray(w)).items;
597            prevLine = (prevLineBytes = new ByteArray(w)).items;
598        } else {
599            lineOut = lineOutBytes.ensureCapacity(w);
600            curLine = curLineBytes.ensureCapacity(w);
601            prevLine = prevLineBytes.ensureCapacity(w);
602            for (int i = 0, n = lastLineLen; i < n; i++)
603            {
604                prevLine[i] = 0;
605            }
606        }
607
608        lastLineLen = w;
609
610        int color;
611        float adj, str = palette.ditherStrength;
612        for (int y = 0; y < h; y++) {
613            int py = flipY ? (h - y - 1) : y;
614            for (int px = 0; px < w; px++) {
615                color = pixmap.getPixel(px, py) & 0xF8F8F880;
616                if ((color & 0x80) == 0 && hasTransparent)
617                    curLine[px] = 0;
618                else {
619                    adj = (((px * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL + py * 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL >>> 40) * 0x1p-26f - 0x1p-3f) * str);
620                    color |= (color >>> 5 & 0x07070700) | 0xFE;
621                    int rr = MathUtils.clamp((int) (((color >>> 24)       ) * (1f - adj)), 0, 0xFF);
622                    int gg = MathUtils.clamp((int) (((color >>> 16) & 0xFF) * (1f + adj)), 0, 0xFF);
623                    int bb = MathUtils.clamp((int) (((color >>> 8)  & 0xFF) * (1f + adj)), 0, 0xFF);
624                    curLine[px] = paletteMapping[((rr << 7) & 0x7C00)
625                                    | ((gg << 2) & 0x3E0)
626                                    | ((bb >>> 3))];
627                }
628            }
629
630            lineOut[0] = (byte)(curLine[0] - prevLine[0]);
631
632            //Paeth
633            for (int x = 1; x < w; x++) {
634                int a = curLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
635                int b = prevLine[x] & 0xff;
636                int c = prevLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
637                int p = a + b - c;
638                int pa = p - a;
639                if (pa < 0) pa = -pa;
640                int pb = p - b;
641                if (pb < 0) pb = -pb;
642                int pc = p - c;
643                if (pc < 0) pc = -pc;
644                if (pa <= pb && pa <= pc)
645                    c = a;
646                else if (pb <= pc)
647                    c = b;
648                lineOut[x] = (byte)(curLine[x] - c);
649            }
650
651            deflaterOutput.write(PAETH);
652            deflaterOutput.write(lineOut, 0, w);
653
654            byte[] temp = curLine;
655            curLine = prevLine;
656            prevLine = temp;
657        }
658        deflaterOutput.finish();
659        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
660
661        buffer.writeInt(IEND);
662        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
663
664        output.flush();
665    }
666    /**
667     * Writes the sequence of pixmaps to the given FileHandle as an animated PNG. The animation will loop and will try
668     * to run at {@code fps} frames per second. This will use the default palette for {@link PaletteReducer} if
669     * {@link #palette} is null; if palette is already non-null, you can call {@link PaletteReducer#analyze(Pixmap)} to
670     * compute a palette from one image or exact() to match a specific palette. Always dithers the result using the
671     * Floyd-Steinberg algorithm.
672     *
673     * @param file   a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
674     * @param frames a Pixmap Array to write as a sequence of frames to the given output stream
675     * @param fps    how many frames per second the animation should run at
676     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
677     */
678    public void write(FileHandle file, Array<Pixmap> frames, int fps) throws IOException {
679        write(file, frames, fps, true);
680    }
681
682    /**
683     * Writes the sequence of pixmaps to the given FileHandle as an animated PNG. The animation will loop and will try
684     * to run at {@code fps} frames per second. This will use the default palette for {@link PaletteReducer} if
685     * {@link #palette} is null; if palette is already non-null, you can call {@link PaletteReducer#analyze(Pixmap)} to
686     * compute a palette from one image or exact() to match a specific palette. Optionally dithers the result if
687     * {@code dither} is true; dither uses the Floyd-Steinberg algorithm.
688     *
689     * @param file   a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
690     * @param frames a Pixmap Array to write as a sequence of frames to the given output stream
691     * @param fps    how many frames per second the animation should run at
692     * @param dither true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
693     * @throws IOException if file writing fails for any reason
694     */
695    public void write(FileHandle file, Array<Pixmap> frames, int fps, boolean dither) throws IOException {
696        OutputStream output = file.write(false);
697        try {
698            write(output, frames, fps, dither);
699        } finally {
700            StreamUtils.closeQuietly(output);
701        }
702    }
703
704    /**
705     * Writes the sequence of pixmaps to the stream without closing the stream. The animation will loop and will try
706     * to run at {@code fps} frames per second. This will use the default palette for {@link PaletteReducer} if
707     * {@link #palette} is null; if palette is already non-null, you can call {@link PaletteReducer#analyze(Pixmap)} to
708     * compute a palette from one image or exact() to match a specific palette. Optionally dithers the result if
709     * {@code dither} is true; dither uses the Floyd-Steinberg algorithm.
710     *
711     * @param output an OutputStream that will not be closed
712     * @param frames a Pixmap Array to write as a sequence of frames to the given output stream
713     * @param fps    how many frames per second the animation should run at
714     * @param dither true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
715     */
716    public void write(OutputStream output, Array<Pixmap> frames, int fps, boolean dither) throws IOException {
717        if (palette == null)
718            palette = new PaletteReducer();
719        if (dither)
720            writeDithered(output, frames, fps);
721        else
722            writeSolid(output, frames, fps);
723    }
724
725    private void writeSolid(OutputStream output, Array<Pixmap> frames, int fps) throws IOException {
726        Pixmap pixmap = frames.first();
727        final int[] paletteArray = palette.paletteArray;
728        final byte[] paletteMapping = palette.paletteMapping;
729
730        DeflaterOutputStream deflaterOutput = new DeflaterOutputStream(buffer, deflater);
731        DataOutputStream dataOutput = new DataOutputStream(output);
732        dataOutput.write(SIGNATURE);
733
734        final int width = pixmap.getWidth();
735        final int height = pixmap.getHeight();
736
737        buffer.writeInt(IHDR);
738        buffer.writeInt(width);
739        buffer.writeInt(height);
740        buffer.writeByte(8); // 8 bits per component.
741        buffer.writeByte(COLOR_INDEXED);
742        buffer.writeByte(COMPRESSION_DEFLATE);
743        buffer.writeByte(FILTER_NONE);
744        buffer.writeByte(INTERLACE_NONE);
745        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
746
747        buffer.writeInt(PLTE);
748        for (int i = 0; i < paletteArray.length; i++) {
749            int p = paletteArray[i];
750            buffer.write(p >>> 24);
751            buffer.write(p >>> 16);
752            buffer.write(p >>> 8);
753        }
754        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
755
756        boolean hasTransparent = false;
757        if (paletteArray[0] == 0) {
758            hasTransparent = true;
759            buffer.writeInt(TRNS);
760            buffer.write(0);
761            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
762        }
763        buffer.writeInt(acTL);
764        buffer.writeInt(frames.size);
765        buffer.writeInt(0);
766        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
767
768        byte[] lineOut, curLine, prevLine;
769        int color;
770        int seq = 0;
771        for (int i = 0; i < frames.size; i++) {
772
773            buffer.writeInt(fcTL);
774            buffer.writeInt(seq++);
775            buffer.writeInt(width);
776            buffer.writeInt(height);
777            buffer.writeInt(0);
778            buffer.writeInt(0);
779            buffer.writeShort(1);
780            buffer.writeShort(fps);
781            buffer.writeByte(0);
782            buffer.writeByte(0);
783            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
784
785            if (i == 0) {
786                buffer.writeInt(IDAT);
787            } else {
788                pixmap = frames.get(i);
789                buffer.writeInt(fdAT);
790                buffer.writeInt(seq++);
791            }
792            deflater.reset();
793
794            if (lineOutBytes == null) {
795                lineOut = (lineOutBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
796                curLine = (curLineBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
797                prevLine = (prevLineBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
798            } else {
799                lineOut = lineOutBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
800                curLine = curLineBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
801                prevLine = prevLineBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
802                for (int ln = 0, n = lastLineLen; ln < n; ln++)
803                    prevLine[ln] = 0;
804            }
805            lastLineLen = width;
806
807            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
808                int py = flipY ? (height - y - 1) : y;
809                for (int px = 0; px < width; px++) {
810                    color = pixmap.getPixel(px, py);
811                    if ((color & 0x80) == 0 && hasTransparent)
812                        curLine[px] = 0;
813                    else {
814                        int rr = ((color >>> 24));
815                        int gg = ((color >>> 16) & 0xFF);
816                        int bb = ((color >>> 8) & 0xFF);
817                        curLine[px] = paletteMapping[((rr << 7) & 0x7C00)
818                                | ((gg << 2) & 0x3E0)
819                                | ((bb >>> 3))];
820                    }
821                }
822
823                lineOut[0] = (byte) (curLine[0] - prevLine[0]);
824
825                //Paeth
826                for (int x = 1; x < width; x++) {
827                    int a = curLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
828                    int b = prevLine[x] & 0xff;
829                    int c = prevLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
830                    int p = a + b - c;
831                    int pa = p - a;
832                    if (pa < 0) pa = -pa;
833                    int pb = p - b;
834                    if (pb < 0) pb = -pb;
835                    int pc = p - c;
836                    if (pc < 0) pc = -pc;
837                    if (pa <= pb && pa <= pc)
838                        c = a;
839                    else if (pb <= pc)
840                        c = b;
841                    lineOut[x] = (byte) (curLine[x] - c);
842                }
843
844                deflaterOutput.write(PAETH);
845                deflaterOutput.write(lineOut, 0, width);
846
847                byte[] temp = curLine;
848                curLine = prevLine;
849                prevLine = temp;
850            }
851            deflaterOutput.finish();
852            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
853        }
854
855        buffer.writeInt(IEND);
856        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
857
858        output.flush();
859    }
860
861    private void writeDithered(OutputStream output, Array<Pixmap> frames, int fps) throws IOException {
862        Pixmap pixmap = frames.first();
863        final int[] paletteArray = palette.paletteArray;
864        final byte[] paletteMapping = palette.paletteMapping;
865
866        DeflaterOutputStream deflaterOutput = new DeflaterOutputStream(buffer, deflater);
867        DataOutputStream dataOutput = new DataOutputStream(output);
868        dataOutput.write(SIGNATURE);
869
870        final int width = pixmap.getWidth();
871        final int height = pixmap.getHeight();
872
873        buffer.writeInt(IHDR);
874        buffer.writeInt(width);
875        buffer.writeInt(height);
876        buffer.writeByte(8); // 8 bits per component.
877        buffer.writeByte(COLOR_INDEXED);
878        buffer.writeByte(COMPRESSION_DEFLATE);
879        buffer.writeByte(FILTER_NONE);
880        buffer.writeByte(INTERLACE_NONE);
881        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
882
883        buffer.writeInt(PLTE);
884        for (int i = 0; i < paletteArray.length; i++) {
885            int p = paletteArray[i];
886            buffer.write(p >>> 24);
887            buffer.write(p >>> 16);
888            buffer.write(p >>> 8);
889        }
890        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
891
892        boolean hasTransparent = false;
893        if (paletteArray[0] == 0) {
894            hasTransparent = true;
895            buffer.writeInt(TRNS);
896            buffer.write(0);
897            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
898        }
899        buffer.writeInt(acTL);
900        buffer.writeInt(frames.size);
901        buffer.writeInt(0);
902        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
903
904        byte[] lineOut, curLine, prevLine;
905        byte[] curErrorRed, nextErrorRed, curErrorGreen, nextErrorGreen, curErrorBlue, nextErrorBlue;
906        int color;
907        if (palette.curErrorRedBytes == null) {
908            curErrorRed = (palette.curErrorRedBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
909            nextErrorRed = (palette.nextErrorRedBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
910            curErrorGreen = (palette.curErrorGreenBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
911            nextErrorGreen = (palette.nextErrorGreenBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
912            curErrorBlue = (palette.curErrorBlueBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
913            nextErrorBlue = (palette.nextErrorBlueBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
914        } else {
915            curErrorRed = palette.curErrorRedBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
916            nextErrorRed = palette.nextErrorRedBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
917            curErrorGreen = palette.curErrorGreenBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
918            nextErrorGreen = palette.nextErrorGreenBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
919            curErrorBlue = palette.curErrorBlueBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
920            nextErrorBlue = palette.nextErrorBlueBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
921            for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
922                nextErrorRed[i] = 0;
923                nextErrorGreen[i] = 0;
924                nextErrorBlue[i] = 0;
925            }
926        }
927
928        lastLineLen = width;
929
930        int used, rdiff, gdiff, bdiff;
931        byte er, eg, eb, paletteIndex;
932        float w1 = palette.ditherStrength * 0.125f, w3 = w1 * 3f, w5 = w1 * 5f, w7 = w1 * 7f;
933
934        int seq = 0;
935        for (int i = 0; i < frames.size; i++) {
936
937            buffer.writeInt(fcTL);
938            buffer.writeInt(seq++);
939            buffer.writeInt(width);
940            buffer.writeInt(height);
941            buffer.writeInt(0);
942            buffer.writeInt(0);
943            buffer.writeShort(1);
944            buffer.writeShort(fps);
945            buffer.writeByte(0);
946            buffer.writeByte(0);
947            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
948
949            if (i == 0) {
950                buffer.writeInt(IDAT);
951            } else {
952                pixmap = frames.get(i);
953                buffer.writeInt(fdAT);
954                buffer.writeInt(seq++);
955            }
956            deflater.reset();
957
958            if (lineOutBytes == null) {
959                lineOut = (lineOutBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
960                curLine = (curLineBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
961                prevLine = (prevLineBytes = new ByteArray(width)).items;
962            } else {
963                lineOut = lineOutBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
964                curLine = curLineBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
965                prevLine = prevLineBytes.ensureCapacity(width);
966                for (int ln = 0, n = lastLineLen; ln < n; ln++)
967                    prevLine[ln] = 0;
968            }
969            lastLineLen = width;
970
971            for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
972                int py = flipY ? (height - y - 1) : y;
973                int ny = flipY ? (height - y - 2) : y + 1;
974                for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
975                    curErrorRed[x] = nextErrorRed[x];
976                    curErrorGreen[x] = nextErrorGreen[x];
977                    curErrorBlue[x] = nextErrorBlue[x];
978                    nextErrorRed[x] = 0;
979                    nextErrorGreen[x] = 0;
980                    nextErrorBlue[x] = 0;
981                }
982                for (int px = 0; px < width; px++) {
983                    color = pixmap.getPixel(px, py) & 0xF8F8F880;
984                    if ((color & 0x80) == 0 && hasTransparent)
985                        curLine[px] = 0;
986                    else {
987                        er = curErrorRed[px];
988                        eg = curErrorGreen[px];
989                        eb = curErrorBlue[px];
990                        color |= (color >>> 5 & 0x07070700) | 0xFE;
991                        int rr = MathUtils.clamp(((color >>> 24)) + (er), 0, 0xFF);
992                        int gg = MathUtils.clamp(((color >>> 16) & 0xFF) + (eg), 0, 0xFF);
993                        int bb = MathUtils.clamp(((color >>> 8) & 0xFF) + (eb), 0, 0xFF);
994                        curLine[px] = paletteIndex =
995                                paletteMapping[((rr << 7) & 0x7C00)
996                                        | ((gg << 2) & 0x3E0)
997                                        | ((bb >>> 3))];
998                        used = paletteArray[paletteIndex & 0xFF];
999                        rdiff = (color >>> 24) - (used >>> 24);
1000                        gdiff = (color >>> 16 & 255) - (used >>> 16 & 255);
1001                        bdiff = (color >>> 8 & 255) - (used >>> 8 & 255);
1002                        if (px < width - 1) {
1003                            curErrorRed[px + 1] += rdiff * w7;
1004                            curErrorGreen[px + 1] += gdiff * w7;
1005                            curErrorBlue[px + 1] += bdiff * w7;
1006                        }
1007                        if (ny < height) {
1008                            if (px > 0) {
1009                                nextErrorRed[px - 1] += rdiff * w3;
1010                                nextErrorGreen[px - 1] += gdiff * w3;
1011                                nextErrorBlue[px - 1] += bdiff * w3;
1012                            }
1013                            if (px < width - 1) {
1014                                nextErrorRed[px + 1] += rdiff * w1;
1015                                nextErrorGreen[px + 1] += gdiff * w1;
1016                                nextErrorBlue[px + 1] += bdiff * w1;
1017                            }
1018                            nextErrorRed[px] += rdiff * w5;
1019                            nextErrorGreen[px] += gdiff * w5;
1020                            nextErrorBlue[px] += bdiff * w5;
1021                        }
1022                    }
1023                }
1024                lineOut[0] = (byte) (curLine[0] - prevLine[0]);
1025
1026                //Paeth
1027                for (int x = 1; x < width; x++) {
1028                    int a = curLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
1029                    int b = prevLine[x] & 0xff;
1030                    int c = prevLine[x - 1] & 0xff;
1031                    int p = a + b - c;
1032                    int pa = p - a;
1033                    if (pa < 0) pa = -pa;
1034                    int pb = p - b;
1035                    if (pb < 0) pb = -pb;
1036                    int pc = p - c;
1037                    if (pc < 0) pc = -pc;
1038                    if (pa <= pb && pa <= pc)
1039                        c = a;
1040                    else if (pb <= pc)
1041                        c = b;
1042                    lineOut[x] = (byte) (curLine[x] - c);
1043                }
1044
1045                deflaterOutput.write(PAETH);
1046                deflaterOutput.write(lineOut, 0, width);
1047
1048                byte[] temp = curLine;
1049                curLine = prevLine;
1050                prevLine = temp;
1051            }
1052            deflaterOutput.finish();
1053            buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
1054        }
1055
1056        buffer.writeInt(IEND);
1057        buffer.endChunk(dataOutput);
1058
1059        output.flush();
1060    }
1061
1062    /** Should probably be done explicitly; finalize() has been scheduled for removal from the JVM. */
1063    public void dispose () {
1064        deflater.end();
1065    }
1066
1067    static class ChunkBuffer extends DataOutputStream {
1068        final ByteArrayOutputStream buffer;
1069        final CRC32 crc;
1070
1071        ChunkBuffer (int initialSize) {
1072            this(new ByteArrayOutputStream(initialSize), new CRC32());
1073        }
1074
1075        private ChunkBuffer (ByteArrayOutputStream buffer, CRC32 crc) {
1076            super(new CheckedOutputStream(buffer, crc));
1077            this.buffer = buffer;
1078            this.crc = crc;
1079        }
1080
1081        public void endChunk (DataOutputStream target) throws IOException {
1082            flush();
1083            target.writeInt(buffer.size() - 4);
1084            buffer.writeTo(target);
1085            target.writeInt((int)crc.getValue());
1086            buffer.reset();
1087            crc.reset();
1088        }
1089    }
1090}
